sledgehammer.lua.core

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • sledgehammer.util.Printable
      • sledgehammer.lua.LuaObject
        • sledgehammer.lua.LuaTable
          • sledgehammer.lua.core.Color
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Color>

    public class Color
extends LuaTable
implements java.lang.Comparable<Color>
    LuaTable that handles the storage of color data, and color utilities for the Sledgehammer engine.
    Author:
    Jab

             float g,
             float b,
             float a)

        g - The Float green value, between 0 and 1.
        b - The Float blue value, between 0 and 1.
        a - The Float alpha value, between 0 and 1.

      • Color

        public Color(se.krka.kahlua.vm.KahluaTable table)
        Lua load constructor.
        Parameters:
        table - The KahluaTable storing the Color data.

      • Color

        public Color()
        Empty Constructor. The default color is Black, being that red will be 0, green will be 0, blue will be 0, and alpha will be 1.

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Color other)
        Returns 0 if the other color matches. Returns 1 if not matching. Returns 2 if the colors match, however the alpha do not.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Color>
        Parameters:
        other - The Color to compare.
        Returns:
        Returns the standard Integer result from Comparators.

      • limit

        public static float limit(float value)
        Limits a float value between 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        value - The Float value to limit. If the value is lower than 0, 0 will be returned. if the value is larger than 1, then 1 is returned.
        Returns:
        Returns a value between or equal to 0 or 1.

      • limit

        public static float limit(float value,
                          float minimum,
                          float maximum)
        Limits a float value between a given minimum value, and maximum value.
        Parameters:
        value - The Float value to limit. If the value is lower than the Float minimum value, the minimum value will be returned. if the value is larger than the Float maximum value, then the maximum value is returned.
        minimum - The Float minimum value for the returned Float value to be returned.
        maximum - The Float maximum value for the returned Float value to be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns the processed Float value between the Float minimum and Float maximum value given.

      • getColor

        public static Color getColor(java.lang.String color)
        Parameters:
        color - The String name of the color.
        Returns:
        Returns a Color Object with the String name. If no Color is registered with the String name given, null is returned.
